urls.title: Environment Agency drops pollution incident reporting
urls.description: The Environment Agency (EA) has changed the way it reports its corporate performance, dropping a goal of reducing pollution incidents while introducing climate adaptation and air quality targets.

tweets.text: @EmmaMacLusby @BradfordNature @bradfordmdc @Ilkleytennis @IlkleyChat @EnvAgencyYNE Presumably so they can do work on that bank section to prevent further rapid erosion. Once the martins/kingfishers start nesting they have to wait until nesting is over. They like to do this work when the river is low in the summer.

Sadly not a one off. I am afraid to say it looks like the illegal waste fires of St Mary Cray are back in business after a 6 month break. 

@KateLymer @BromleyLFB @LBofBromley @EnvAgency @Pierce_Chris_D @NewsShopper @MPSCrayValleyE @FoEBromley @GreenercleanerB https://t.co/AXIQFDHqow

@JohnAltringham @BradfordNature @bradfordmdc @Ilkleytennis @IlkleyChat @EnvAgencyYNE Thanks John. Why would they want to prevent sand martins nesting here? Netting is a worrying trend elsewhere - but here, sand martins? And maybe kingfisher too.

@EmmaMacLusby @BradfordNature @bradfordmdc @Ilkleytennis @IlkleyChat Looks like netting to prevent sand martins nesting. Given the loss of a good nesting site just upstream, when the bank was reinforced with stone blocks, it would be good to see consideration given to the provision of artificial nests alongside future work. @EnvAgencyYNE

Hi @bradfordmdc @Ilkleytennis do you know why there is matting on the river bank in Ilkley? I‚Äôm concerned it will prevent sand martins from nesting. Via @IlkleyChat on Facebook. https://t.co/xLlF206Eoo

urls.description: Considers the present groundwater levels in the Birmingham aquifer and predicts future levels under varying assumptions. Evaluates the engineering implications of the groundwater levels on building fabric, structure, foundations, basements, tunnels and underground services with observations on integrity and serviceability. Examines the possible effects on groundwater quality, and the implications for surface water quality and drainage. Assesses existing local groundwater control schemes and the need for
